abstract.text: The dashboard that allows players to access their Game Center data in your game.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: This view controller presents the dashboard from which players can browse and manage their Game Center data. You can present the dashboard in a specific state from which players can navigate to other areas, including their profile. Your game should pause other activities before presenting the dashboard.
To present the dashboard, initialize a new

object and set its delegate. Optionally, initialize a view controller in a specific state, to show a leaderboard with scores from a set of players or during a time period, or to show a specific achievement. Then present the view controller to the player, and GameKit calls your delegate when the player dismisses it.

For visionOS games, the dashboard appears anchored to the window, scene, or view relative to where you present the view controller. For immersive games, set the parent window to a separate window group than the immersive space window group. For the visionOS location of the dashboard when using the access point, see

abstract.text: Enable players to interact with friends, compare leaderboard ranks, earn achievements, and participate in multiplayer games.
An object that allows players to view and manage their Game Center information from within your game.
An
object provides a standard user interface to display achievement progress for the local player. If the
class is available, you should use it instead.
An object that provides the ability to present the dashboard in macOS games.
The delegate that GameKit calls when the player dismisses the dashboard.
The dashboard that allows players to access their Game Center data in your game.
The view controller’s delegate.
Creates a view controller that presents an achievement.
Creates a view controller that presents a leaderboard with data for the specified players.
Creates a view controller that presents a leaderboard with data from the specified players and time period.
Creates a view controller that presents a leaderboard set.
Creates a view controller that presents a player’s Game Center profile.
Creates a view controller that presents the specified Game Center content.
The type of content for the view controller to present.
The
class provides a standard user interface that displays leaderboard scores to the player. If the
class is available, you should use it instead.
A Game Center-style banner that displays a message to the local player.
The abstract base protocol adopted by GameKit view controller classes.
Provide your users a convenient connection to the Game Center dashboard.

Configure the access point on visionOS

abstract.text: Provide an interface for players to navigate to their Game Center data from your game.
Review unsupported symbols and their replacements.
A controller that manages a view, typically loaded from a nib file.
A container view controller that defines a stack-based scheme for navigating hierarchical content.
A protocol that enables an object to be encoded and decoded for archiving and distribution.
The interface an app extension uses to respond to a request from a host app.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A set of methods that support the mediation of a custom segue.
Methods that responder subclasses implement to support key binding commands, such as inserting tabs and newlines, or moving the insertion point.
A protocol that an object adopts to create a bar object in your app.
A protocol that marks classes to restore the state of your app to continue a user activity.
A set of methods used to associate a unique identifier with objects in your user interface.
An interface that provides a source for shareable content to fulfill user requests to share current content.
A protocol that a class must adopt to allow appearance customization using the [`UIAppearance`](doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIAppearance) API.
A set of methods for adapting the contents of your view controllers to size and trait changes.
A set of methods that define the focus behavior for a branch of the view hierarchy.
The interface that determines whether a responder object supports paste configuration.
A set of standard methods that apps can adopt to support editing.
Methods for adding objects to your state restoration archives.
A set of methods that makes the iOS interface environment available to your app.
The protocol you adopt to restore an object’s state from a user activity.
A type that calls your code in reaction to changes in the trait environment.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A singleton actor whose executor is equivalent to the main dispatch queue.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
A thread-safe type whose values can be shared across arbitrary concurrent contexts without introducing a risk of data races.
